page.title: 02ST.BUDOCK C. OF E. SCHOOL
page.content: This school was built as a poor house in 1803.Pupils were first taught in the middle of the 3 cottages next door to the school from about 1816.We have the oldest boiler in any Cornish school.Many alterations have been made since. Mr.Axe was appointed headmaster in January 1974.There was one other teacher but no secretary. Today there are 6 teaching spaces and 5 teachers:Mr.Axe,Mrs.Griffiths,Mrs. Kessell,Miss Marshall,Mrs.Chatterton. We have two helpers, Mrs Dale and Mrs Kitchener.Playtimes are at 10.30,12.30 and 2.30.We start school at 9.00 and go home at 3.30.There are 75 boys and 57 girls in the school.Less than one third of the pupils come from Budock. 4 Dinner ladies,2 cleaners and a secretary also work at this school.
